results.title: Live a life
results.creator_credit: Parallax Pictures, Sally Hibbin and Maxim Ford
results.brief_description: A concert for the unemployed was staged at the Rainbow with a line-up that included Tom Robinson, the Beat, Black Slate, OK Jive and Alexei Sayle. This film is a record of that concert and of the situation which prompted it. Discussions with the young unemployed are set against the rhetoric of the Thatcher regime.

results.title: Live & or let die
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Best of Lateline”.
This lateline program examines the issues surrounding the legalisation of euthanasia. The first portion of the program looks at the situation in Holland where euthanasia is decriminalised. The second portion of the program is a panel discussion between 3 doctors who present a range of opinions on this topic. The video includes Teacher’s Notes. No other credits available.

results.title: Liu awaiting spring
results.creator_credit: New South Wales Film and Television Office, Over Exposed Productions, Nadine Umback and Andrew Soo
results.brief_description: Set against traditional Chinese music and imagery such as calligraphy and performance art a young gay Chinese man faces the dilemma of “coming out” to his family. His dilemma is complicated by the fact that one of their relatives has died from AIDS.

results.title: Little women (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Louisa May Alcott’s popular novel is brought vividly to life in this second screen adaption of “Little Women.” The March sisters are Jo (June Allyson), Beth (Janet Leigh), Amy (a blonde Elizabeth Taylor) and Meg (child-star Margaret O’Brien). Their father has left for the Civil War, leaving the girls under the watchful eye of their mother (Mary Astor). Far removed from war and safe within their New England home, the “little women” are a closely-knit family and a picture of happiness. When Laurie (Peter Lawford), the grandson of a rich neighbor arrives, the orderly world of the March family is disrupted. The sisters are smitten by this handsome stranger and a story of romance, rivalry, love and loss follows. As the high spirited and determined Jo, June Allyson gives one of the finest performances of her career, ably supported by the superb ensemble cast. The film is beautifully crafted and deservedly received an Academy Award nomination for its exceptional cinematography. Co-starring Rossano Brazzi as Professor Bhaer.

results.title: Little Women
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Denise Di Novi and Gillian Armstrong
results.brief_description: A glowing depiction of the true nature of family, the search for self and feminine independence based on the classic novel by Louisa May Alcott. Gillian Armstrong’s compelling film captures the romantic dramas and adventures of Mrs March and her four “little women”.

constellations_other.name: Brilliant careers (Gillian Armstrong)
constellations_other.description: Gillian Armstrong's feature film debut not only helped launch her own acclaimed career, but those of the actors as well.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Columbia Pictures, Denise Di Novi and Gillian Armstrong
results.description: A glowing depiction of the true nature of family, the search for self and feminine independence based on the classic novel by Louisa May Alcott. Gillian Armstrong’s compelling film captures the romantic dramas and adventures of Mrs March (Susan Sarandon) and her four “little women”: spirited Jo (Winona Ryder), beautiful Meg (Trini Alvarado), fragile Beth (Claire Danes) and romantic Amy (Kirsten Dunst).
description_for_label: A glowing depiction of the true nature of family, the search for self and feminine independence based on the classic novel by Louisa May Alcott. results.title: Little Women
results.brief_description: One of the most enduring of the Hollywood movie classics, “Little Women” is based on Louisa May Alcott’s beloved novel. It is the story of four sisters who grow up together in Massachusetts during the Civil War. We enter their world to share their joys and sorrows as they become the “little women” that their father so proudly calls them. Stars Katherine Hepburn, Douglas Montgomery, Paul Lukas, Joan Bennett, Frances Dee and Jean Parker.

results.title: Little women
results.creator_credit: BBC, John McCrae and Paddy Russell
results.brief_description: In New England, the Civil War rages and the women left at home must struggle, many deprived of their menfolk, sticking together to survive and enjoy life regardless of the hardships. So it befell the March family, those “little women” of Louisa May Alcott’s novel which has delighted children and adults for generations. There is headstrong Jo, fiercely intent on a writing career, Meg with her love of life’s finer things, Amy’s wilful tantrums as she struggles through adolescence and the quiet Beth, calm in her world of music. Sibling rivalry, happy adventures and pure joy in living, despite the difficult times, are evident in this charming adaptation of the classic novel.

results.title: Little white lies
results.brief_description: Coming out is hard to do - but is procrastinating any easier? Reb finds that when you’ve got a secret and they’ve got your number, a little white lie can sometimes do wonders - but not always. Cast features Joy Smithers and Sylvia Mircevsky.

results.title: Little white lies
results.brief_description: Focused on developments in communication technology, this fast paced morality farce features modern convenience as an inexhaustible persecutor. Reb finds that when you’ve got a secret and they’ve got your number, a little white lie can sometimes do wonders - but not always.
